Bases: object

class polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.Matrix(primary, secondary)[source]¶

Bases: object

class polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.Node(col=None, value=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.add_row(matrix, indices)[source]¶

Appends the sparse row indices to the matrix.

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.cover(c)[source]¶

Removes c from the selection and removes all colliding rows.

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.find_all(matrix)[source]¶

Find all solutions to the exact cover problem.

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.find_first(matrix)[source]¶

Find one solution to the exact cover problem.

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.find_rows(matrix)[source]¶

Find one solution and return the options represented by their row id and content.

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.force_option(matrix, col_id, value)[source]¶

Ensure a specific option (row) is included in all solutions.

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.generate_solutions(matrix)[source]¶

A generator function version of the ‘solve’ function Generator-based backtracking search using the matrix data structure with MRV heuristic.

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.hide(p)[source]¶

Hide the row from the matrix.

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.mrv(matrix)[source]¶

Uses Knuth’s MRV heuristic to choose the column with the fewest rows.

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.pretty_print(matrix)[source]¶

Print a non-sparse table representation of the matrix for debugging.

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.solve(matrix, collector, first)[source]¶

Backtracking search using the matrix data structure with MRV heuristic.

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.uncover(c)[source]¶

Undoes the deletion done by cover(c).

polyhex.solver_functions.algorithm_x_functions.unhide(p)[source]¶

Unhide the row in the matrix.
